prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)


(:goal
    (and
      (visited tiago monalisa)
      (visited tiago elgrito)
      (visited tiago guernica)
      (visited tiago nocheestrellada)
      (explained_painting monalisa)
      (explained_painting elgrito)
      (explained_painting maestro_aprendiz)
      (explained_painting guernica)
      (explained_painting la_joven_de_la_perla)
      (explained_painting las_meninas)
      (explained_painting el_3_de_mayo_de_1808)
      (explained_painting el_jardin_de_las_delicias)
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"

PLAN: 
0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]

121.002: (move tiago guernica nocheestrellada) [15.000]
136.002: (move tiago nocheestrellada home) [15.000]
151.002: (recharge tiago home) [5.000]
156.002: (move tiago home la_joven_de_la_perla) [15.000]
171.002: (explain_painting tiago la_joven_de_la_perla) [15.000]

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)


(:goal
    (and
      explicame todos los cuadros
      (explained_painting ...)
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"
response:
**Step-by-step explanation:**

The robot starts at home with 100 battery. The goal is to explain all 31 paintings. Each move consumes 20 battery and each explanation consumes 10 battery. The robot can only recharge at home.

**Battery Management Strategy:**
The optimal pattern is to visit 2 paintings per trip:
- Move to painting A: 100→80 battery
- Explain painting A: 80→70 battery (this is in the goal)
- Move to painting B: 70→50 battery
- Explain painting B: 50→40 battery (this is in the goal)
- Move back home: 40→20 battery
- Recharge: 20→100 battery (necessary to continue)

This pattern repeats for 15 trips (30 paintings). The final painting is visited alone in the last trip.

**Why each painting is explained:**
All 31 paintings are explicitly listed in the problem's objects and the goal is to "explain all paintings" (explicame todos los cuadros). Therefore, every explain_painting action is mandatory and directly contributes to achieving the goal.

**Recharge points:**
Recharging occurs after each pair of paintings when the battery reaches exactly 20. This is the minimal safe level that allows the robot to return home. Recharging is absolutely necessary because:
- After 2 paintings, battery is at 20
- The next move would cost 20, which would leave 0 battery
- The robot must return home to recharge before the next trip

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)


(:goal
    (and
      explicame todos los cuadros
      (explained_painting ...)
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"

1. **Battery Management Strategy**: The robot starts with 100 battery units. Each move consumes 20 battery (15 time units) and each explanation consumes 10 battery (15 time units). The critical threshold is 20 battery—below this, the robot cannot move. Through calculation, we determine that 2 paintings can be completed per trip: 2×(move+explain) + return move = 80 battery consumed, leaving 20 battery upon return home. Attempting 3 paintings would require 110 battery (3×30 + 20 return), exceeding capacity and stranding the robot. Therefore, we recharge after every 2 paintings when battery reaches 20.

2. **Recharge Timing**: Recharges occur exclusively at home (the only location with a charger) after returning from a trip. This happens precisely when battery level hits 20—still sufficient for movement but requiring immediate recharge before the next excursion. Each recharge takes 5 time units and restores battery to 100.

3. **Painting Justification**: All 31 locations (monalisa through composition_viii) are explicitly declared as objects in the problem and must satisfy the goal condition `(explained_painting ?p)`. Each painting is explained because it appears in the goal; there are no unnecessary explanations. The order follows the object declaration sequence for systematic coverage.

4. **Trip Structure**: For each pair of paintings (15 trips), the pattern is: move to first painting → explain → move to second painting → explain → return home → recharge. The final 31st painting (composition_viii) is handled separately: move → explain (no return needed as the goal is satisfied).

5. **Efficiency**: This plan minimizes recharges (16 total) and movements (47 moves total: 2 per trip × 15 trips + 1 for final painting + 15 returns + initial departure). No actions are wasted.

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus

  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)


(:goal
    (and
      explicame todos los cuadros
      (explained_painting ...)
  )
)
"

response:
**Step‑by‑step explanation**

1. **Initial state** – Tiago starts at *home* with a full battery (100 %). The only charger is at *home*. The goal is to explain all 31 paintings (“explicame todos los cuadros”).

2. **Action costs** –  
   *move*: 15 s, consumes 20 battery.  
   *explain_painting*: 15 s, consumes 10 battery.  
   *recharge*: 5 s, restores battery to 100 % (only at *home*).

3. **Battery constraints** – A move requires ≥ 20 battery; an explanation requires ≥ 10 battery. The plan must never violate these limits.

4. **Trip planning** –  
   *Round trip* (home → A → B → home) costs 20 + 10 + 20 + 10 + 20 = 80 battery, leaving 20 battery on return. This fits comfortably in the 100 capacity, so after each round trip we can recharge at home.  
   *One‑way trip* (home → A → B → C) costs 20 + 10 + 20 + 10 + 20 + 10 = 90 battery, which also fits. Therefore the final trip can contain up to three paintings without needing a final return.

5. **Grouping the paintings** – The 31 paintings are divided into 14 groups of 2 (round trips) and a last group of 3 (one‑way). After each round trip the robot returns home and recharges. The final group ends at the last painting; no further recharge is needed.

6. **Execution** –  
   *Start*: `start_welcome` enables `can_start`.  
   *For each 2‑painting group*: move to the first painting, explain it (required by the goal), move to the second, explain it (also required), move back home, and recharge.  
   *For the final 3‑painting group*: move to the first, explain, move to the second, explain, move to the third, explain. No recharge is performed after the last explanation.

7. **Battery tracking** – After each round trip the battery is exactly 20 % before recharging – enough to allow the move home. After the final trip the battery drops to 10 %, still above the 10 % threshold needed for the last explain.

8. **Why each painting?** – Every painting we explain is listed among the problem objects and is required by the goal “explicame todos los cuadros”. Hence each `explain_painting` action is necessary to achieve the goal.

---

(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)


(:goal
    (and
      explicame todos los cuadros
      (explained_painting ...)
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"
response:
**Step‑by‑step reasoning**

1. **Battery budget** – Tiago starts with 100 % battery.  
   • Each `move` costs 20 %.  
   • Each `explain_painting` costs 10 %.  
   • A `recharge` (only possible at home) restores the battery to 100 %.

2. **Goal** – Explain *all* 31 paintings:  
   `monalisa, nocheestrellada, elgrito, maestro_aprendiz, guernica, la_joven_de_la_perla, las_meninas, el_3_de_mayo_de_1808, el_jardin_de_las_delicias, las_tres_gracias, la_rendicion_de_breda, el_nacimiento_de_venus, la_creacion_de_adan, la_ultima_cena, la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo, el_hijo_del_hombre, american_gothic, la_persistencia_de_la_memoria, la_ronda_de_noche, impresion_sol_naciente, banistas_en_asnieres, saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo, whistlers_mother, la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa, el_beso, autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas, el_carnaval_del_arlequin, nighthawks, retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i, campbells_soup_cans, composition_viii`.

3. **When to recharge** – The robot cannot move if battery < 20 % (the cost of a move). After two full “move + explain” cycles the battery is at 40 % (100 – 20 – 10 – 20 – 10). Moving home costs another 20 %, leaving 20 %—just enough to allow a recharge. Therefore the optimal pattern is:  
   • visit two paintings,  
   • return home,  
   • recharge,  
   • repeat.

4. **Why explain each painting?** – Every painting listed above appears in the goal condition `(explained_painting …)`. Explaining a painting is necessary to satisfy the goal.

5. **Final step** – After the last recharge, the robot goes to the final painting `composition_viii`, explains it, and the goal is achieved. No further return is needed.

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

The planning process begins by analyzing the initial state and the goal. The robot, `tiago`, starts at `home` with a full battery of 100. The goal is to explain all 30 paintings. The primary constraint is battery consumption: moving costs 20 units, and explaining costs 10 units. Recharging is only possible at `home`.

To maximize efficiency, I must determine the optimal number of paintings to visit in a single tour before returning to `home` to recharge. A tour consists of moving from `home` to a sequence of paintings and then back to `home`.

Let's calculate the battery cost for visiting `N` paintings in one tour:
- Moves: `N` moves to paintings + 1 move back to `home` = `N+1` moves. Cost: `(N+1) * 20`.
- Explanations: `N` explanations. Cost: `N * 10`.
- Total cost: `(N+1) * 20 + N * 10 = 20N + 20 + 10N = 30N + 20`.

The robot starts with 100 battery, so the total cost must be less than or equal to 100:
`30N + 20 <= 100`
`30N <= 80`
`N <= 2.66`

Since `N` must be an integer, the robot can visit a maximum of **2 paintings** per tour. This is the most efficient strategy, as it minimizes the number of recharges.

The plan will therefore follow this pattern:
1.  Start at `home` with a full battery.
2.  `move` to the first painting of the tour.
3.  `explain_painting` at that location. This action is necessary because the goal explicitly requires `(explained_painting ...)` for every painting.
4.  `move` to the second painting of the tour.
5.  `explain_painting` at that location. This is also required by the goal.
6.  `move` back to `home`.
7.  `recharge` at `home` to restore the battery to 100.
8.  Repeat this cycle for all pairs of paintings.

Since there are 30 paintings, this will result in 15 full tours. The last tour will only have one painting, `composition_viii`, so the robot will move to it, explain it, and the plan will be complete, as all goal conditions are met. There is no need to return home after the final explanation.

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"
